findings.title: F-2023-0058 - Redundant Function
findings.description: The `getBlockTimestamp()` and the `getBlockNumber()` functions are redundant, as they only return the global variables `block.timestamp` and `block.number`, leading to unnecessary gas and storage consumption.

findings.title: F-2023-0050 - Unsafe Use of DelegateCall
findings.description: The contract uses delegatecall which does not indicate whether the callee reverted or encountered an exception, leading to execution continuation even if the delegatecall fails.

findings.title: F-2023-0053 - Redundant Fallback function
findings.description: The `Timelock` contracts accept native tokens through `fallback` function. The contract's purpose is not to store native tokens, and this introduces unnecessary complexity, raises deployment costs, and may result in temporary fund lock.

findings.title: F-2023-0055 - Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: Address input parameters are being used without checking against the possibility of 0x0 value.

findings.title: F-2023-0057 - Missing Validation Of msg.value In executeTransaction()
findings.description: The `executeTransaction()` function lacks validation to ensure that the `msg.value` used matches the required value for the queued transaction, which may result in a temporary funds lock.

findings.title: F-2023-0060 - Funds Lock
findings.description: The GovernorDelegator.sol contract's fallback function accepts native coins but cannot handle them by design, leading to a funds lock situation.
